paragraphs.text:
%md
# About
**Lab:** Hbase and Hive
**Objective:** Become familiar with using Hive and Hbase mapped tables
**File locations:** /labs/data/
**Successful outcome:** Understanding Hive and Hbase integration
**Before you begin:** N/A
**Related lessons:** HBase Overview 

---

%md
# Setup

paragraphs.title: Make sure you have write permissions to hdfs directory /user/zeppelin
paragraphs.text:
%sh

hdfs dfs -chmod -R 777 /user/zeppelin

paragraphs.title: Store the data in a parquet file
paragraphs.text:
%sh

rm dc-wikia-data.csv*
wget https://github.com/fivethirtyeight/data/raw/master/comic-characters/dc-wikia-data.csv
hdfs dfs -rm /labs/data/dc-wikia-data.csv
hdfs dfs -put dc-wikia-data.csv /labs/data/

%jdbc(hive_interactive)

DROP TABLE IF EXISTS dc_comics_orc_raw;
CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE dc_comics_orc_raw ( 
                        page_id string,
                        name string,
                        urlslug string,
                        ID string,
                        ALIGN string,
                        EYE string,
                        HAIR string,
                        SEX string,
                        GSM string,
                        ALIVE string,
                        APPEARANCES string,
                        FIRST_APPEARANCES string,
                        YEAR string
) ROW FORMAT DELIMITED
FIELDS TERMINATED BY ',' LOCATION '/user/zeppelin/dc_comics/';

LOAD DATA  INPATH '/labs/data/dc-wikia-data.csv' OVERWRITE INTO TABLE dc_comics_orc_raw;

paragraphs.title: Log into terminal console to be able to execute hbase queries
paragraphs.text:
%md

* ssh -o ServerAliveInterval=120 -i training-keypair.pem centos@ec2-54-191-8-20.us-west-2.compute.amazonaws.com **( Use the AWS Ambari node address you are assigned.)**
* Login to Hbase shell and follow the remaining steps in the notebook.

```console
hbase shell
```

%md
# Lab

%md
We are going to create an Hive Hbase managed table
~~~
CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE hbase_dc_comics(
                        page_id string,
                        name string,
                        urlslug string,
                        ID string,
                        ALIGN string,
                        EYE string,
                        HAIR string,
                        SEX string,
                        GSM string,
                        ALIVE string,
                        APPEARANCES int,
                        FIRST_APPEARANCES string,
                        YEAR string)
STORED BY 'org.apache.hadoop.hive.hbase.HBaseStorageHandler'
WITH SERDEPROPERTIES ("hbase.columns.mapping" = "cf1:name,cf1:urlslug,cf1:ID,cf1:ALIGN,cf2:EYE,cf2:HAIR,cf2:SEX,cf2:GSM,cf2:Alive,cf3:Appearances,cf3:first_appeareances,cf3:year")
TBLPROPERTIES ("hbase.table.name" = "hbase_dc", "hbase.mapred.output.outputtable" = "hbase_dc","transactional"="false")
;
~~~

But first we need to drop the table if it already exists.

paragraphs.title: 1 - Drop and Create the table
3 - Query the Hive Table (Limit to 5)
Query the table in Hbase using the terminal console
paragraphs.text:
%md
~~~
Describe the table in Hbase.
describe "hbase_dc"

Query the table in Hbase
scan "hbase_dc"

~~~

%md
###Practice SQL

%md
Use the file labs/data/marvel-wikia-data.csv to create another Hive HBase Mapped table.

~~~
                        Table Columns
                        
                        page_id string,
                        name string,
                        urlslug string,
                        ID string,
                        ALIGN string,
                        EYE string,
                        HAIR string,
                        SEX string,
                        GSM string,
                        ALIVE string,
                        APPEARANCES string,
                        FIRST_APPEARANCES string,
                        YEAR string

~~~

paragraphs.title: 4 - Create another hive HBase mapped table.

paragraphs.text:
%md
# Result
**You have now:** You have now successfully created a Hive tabled mapped to an HBase table.

---

%md
# Solution
---

paragraphs.title: 1 - Drop and Create the table
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive_interactive)
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS hbase_dc_comics;
CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE hbase_dc_comics(
                        page_id string,
                        name string,
                        urlslug string,
                        ID string,
                        ALIGN string,
                        EYE string,
                        HAIR string,
                        SEX string,
                        GSM string,
                        ALIVE string,
                        APPEARANCES int,
                        FIRST_APPEARANCES string,
                        YEAR string)
STORED BY 'org.apache.hadoop.hive.hbase.HBaseStorageHandler'
WITH SERDEPROPERTIES ("hbase.columns.mapping" = "cf1:name,cf1:urlslug,cf1:ID,cf1:ALIGN,cf2:EYE,cf2:HAIR,cf2:SEX,cf2:GSM,cf2:Alive,cf3:Appearances,cf3:first_appeareances,cf3:year")
TBLPROPERTIES ("hbase.table.name" = "hbase_dc", "hbase.mapred.output.outputtable" = "hbase_dc","transactional"="false")
;

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

[{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

[{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: 2 - Load the Table with data
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive_interactive)
INSERT OVERWRITE TABLE hbase_dc_comics SELECT * FROM dc_comics_orc_raw;

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

[{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: 3 - Query the Hive Table. (Limit to 5)
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive_interactive)
Select * from hbase_dc_comics limit 5;

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.text:
%md
We hope you've enjoyed this lab. Below are additional resources that you should find useful:

1. [Hortonworks Apache Spark Tutorials](http://hortonworks.com/tutorials/#tuts-developers) are your natural next step where you can explore Spark in more depth.
2. [Hortonworks Community Connection (HCC)](https://community.hortonworks.com/spaces/85/data-science.html?type=question) is a great resource for questions and answers on Spark, Data Analytics/Science, and many more Big Data topics.
3. [Hortonworks Apache Spark Docs](https://docs.hortonworks.com/HDPDocuments/HDP3/HDP-3.0.1/spark-overview/content/analyzing_data_with_apache_spark.html) - official Spark documentation.
4. [Hortonworks Apache Zeppelin Docs](https://docs.hortonworks.com/HDPDocuments/HDP3/HDP-3.0.1/zeppelin-overview/content/overview.html) - official Zeppelin documentation.
%angular
%angular
